g4401.definition: [προχειροτονέω] from {{g4253}} and {{g5500}}; to elect in advance

g4402.definition: [Πρόχορος] from {{g4253}} and {{g5525}}; before the dance; Prochorus, a Christian

g4403.definition: [πρύμνα] feminine of πρυμνύς (hindmost); the stern of a ship

g4404.definition: [πρωΐ] adverb from {{g4253}}; at dawn; by implication, the day-break watch

g4405.definition: [πρωΐα] feminine of a derivative of {{g4404}} as noun; day-dawn

g4406.definition: [πρώϊμος] from {{g4404}}; dawning, i.e. (by analogy) autumnal (showering, the first of the rainy season)

g4407.definition: [πρωϊνός] from {{g4404}}; pertaining to the dawn, i.e. matutinal

g4408.definition: [πρῶρα] feminine of a presumed derivative of {{g4253}} as noun; the prow, i.e. forward part of a vessel

g4409.definition: [πρωτεύω] from {{g4413}}; to be first (in rank or influence)

g4410.definition: [πρωτοκαθεδρία] from {{g4413}} and {{g2515}}; a sitting first (in the front row), i.e. preeminence in council

g4411.definition: [πρωτοκλισία] from {{g4413}} and {{g2828}}; a reclining first (in the place of honor) at the dinner-bed, i.e. preeminence at meals

g4412.definition: [πρῶτον] neuter of {{g4413}} as adverb (with or without {{g3588}}); firstly (in time, place, order, or importance)

g4413.definition: [πρῶτος] contracted superlative of {{g4253}}; foremost (in time, place, order or importance)

g4414.definition: [πρωτοστάτης] from {{g4413}} and {{g2476}}; one standing first in the ranks, i.e. a captain (champion)

g4416.definition: [πρωτότοκος] from {{g4413}} and the alternate of {{g5088}}; first-born (usually as noun, literally or figuratively)

g4417.definition: [πταίω] a form of {{g4098}}; to trip, i.e. (figuratively) to err, sin, fail (of salvation)

g4419.definition: [πτερύγιον] neuter of a presumed derivative of {{g4420}}; a winglet, i.e. (figuratively) extremity (top corner)

g4420.definition: [πτέρυξ] from a derivative of {{g4072}} (meaning a feather); a wing

g4422.definition: [πτοέω] probably akin to the alternate of {{g4098}} (through the idea of causing to fall) or to {{g4072}} (through that of causing to fly away); to scare

g4424.definition: [Πτολεμαΐς] from Πτολεμαῖος (Ptolemy, after whom it was named); Ptolemais, a place in Palestine

g4425.definition: [πτύον] from {{g4429}}; a winnowing-fork (as scattering like spittle)

g4426.definition: [πτύρω] from a presumed derivative of {{g4429}} (and thus akin to {{g4422}}); to frighten

g4428.definition: [πτύσσω] probably akin to πετάννυμι (to spread; and thus apparently allied to {{g4072}} through the idea of expansion, and to 4429 through that of flattening; compare {{g3961}}); to fold, i.e. furl a scroll

g4430.definition: [πτῶμα] from the alternate of {{g4098}}; a ruin, i.e. (specially), lifeless body (corpse, carrion)

g4431.definition: [πτῶσις] from the alternate of {{g4098}}; a crash, i.e. downfall (literally or figuratively)

g4432.definition: [πτωχεία] from {{g4433}}; beggary, i.e. indigence (literally or figuratively)

g4433.definition: [πτωχεύω] from {{g4434}}; to be a beggar, i.e. (by implication) to become indigent (figuratively)

g4434.definition: [πτωχός] from πτώσσω (to crouch); akin to {{g4422}} and the alternate of {{g4098}}); a beggar (as cringing), i.e. pauper (strictly denoting absolute or public mendicancy, although also used in a qualified or relative sense; whereas {{g3993}} properly means only straitened circumstances in private), literally (often as noun) or figuratively (distressed)

g4435.definition: [πυγμή] from a primary πύξ (the fist as a weapon); the clenched hand, i.e. (only in dative case as adverb) with the fist (hard scrubbing)

g4436.definition: [Πύθων] from Πυθώ (the name of the region where Delphi, the seat of the famous oracle, was located); a Python, i.e. (by analogy, with the supposed diviner there) inspiration (soothsaying)

g4437.definition: [πυκνός] from the same as {{g4635}}; clasped (thick), i.e. (figuratively) frequent; neuter plural (as adverb) frequently

g4438.definition: [πυκτέω] from a derivative of the same as {{g4435}}; to box (with the fist), i.e. contend (as a boxer) at the games (figuratively)

g4439.definition: [πύλη] apparently a primary word; a gate, i.e. the leaf or wing of a folding entrance (literally or figuratively)

g4440.definition: [πυλών] from {{g4439}}; a gate-way, door-way of a building or city; by implication, a portal or vestibule

g4441.definition: [πυνθάνομαι] middle voice prolonged from a primary πύθω (which occurs only as an alternate in certain tenses); to question, i.e. ascertain by inquiry (as a matter of information merely; and thus differing from {{g2065}}, which properly means a request as a favor; and from {{g154}}, which is strictly a demand for something due; as well as from {{g2212}}, which implies a search for something hidden; and from {{g1189}}, which involves the idea of urgent need); by implication, to learn (by casual intelligence)

g4442.definition: [πῦρ] a primary word; "fire" (literally or figuratively, specially, lightning)

g4444.definition: [πύργος] apparently a primary word ("burgh"); a tower or castle

g4445.definition: [πυρέσσω] from {{g4443}}; to be on fire, i.e. (specially), to have a fever

g4446.definition: [πυρετός] from {{g4445}}; inflamed, i.e. (by implication) feverish (as noun, fever)

g4448.definition: [πυρόω] from {{g4442}}; to kindle, i.e. (passively) to be ignited, glow (literally), be refined (by implication), or (figuratively) to be inflamed (with anger, grief, lust)

g4451.definition: [πύρωσις] from {{g4448}}; ignition, i.e. (specially), smelting (figuratively, conflagration, calamity as a test)

g4452.definition: [-πω] another form of the base of {{g4458}}; an enclitic particle of indefiniteness; yet, even; used only in the comparative. See {{g3369}}, {{g3380}}, {{g3764}}, {{g3768}}, {{g4455}}.

g4453.definition: [πωλέω] probably ultimately from πέλομαι (to be busy, to trade); to barter (as a pedlar), i.e. to sell

g4454.definition: [πῶλος] apparently a primary word; a "foal" or "filly", i.e. (specially), a young ass

g4455.definition: [πώποτε] from {{g4452}} and {{g4218}}; at any time, i.e. (with negative particle) at no time

g4456.definition: [πωρόω] apparently from πῶρος (a kind of stone); to petrify, i.e. (figuratively) to indurate (render stupid or callous)

g4458.definition: [-πώς] adverb from the base of {{g4225}}; an enclitic particle of indefiniteness of manner; somehow or anyhow; used only in composition See {{g1513}}, {{g3381}}. Compare {{g4459}}.

g4459.definition: [πῶς] adverb from the base of {{g4226}}; an interrogative particle of manner; in what way? (sometimes the question is indirect, how?); also as exclamation, how much! (Occasionally unexpressed in English).

g4460.definition: [Ῥαάβ] of Hebrew origin ({{h7343}}); Raab (i.e. Rachab), a Canaanitess See also {{g4477}}.

g4461.definition: [ῥαββί] of Hebrew origin ({{h7227}} with pronominal suffix); my master, i.e Rabbi, as an official title of honor

g4462.definition: [ῥαββονί] , or      ῥαββουνίof Chaldee origin; corresponding to {{g4461}}

g4463.definition: [ῥαβδίζω] from {{g4464}}; to strike with a stick, i.e. bastinado

g4464.definition: [ῥάβδος] from the base of {{g4474}}; a stick or wand (as a cudgel, a cane or a baton of royalty)

g4465.definition: [ῥαβδοῦχος] from {{g4464}} and {{g2192}}; a rod- (the Latin ) holder, i.e. a Roman lictor (constable or executioner)

g4466.definition: [Ῥαγαῦ] of Hebrew origin ({{h7466}}); Ragau (i.e. Reu), a patriarch

g4467.definition: [ῥᾳδιούργημα] from a comparative of ῥᾴδιος (easy, i.e. reckless) and {{g2041}}; easy-going behavior, i.e. (by extension) a crime

g4468.definition: [ῥᾳδιουργία] from the same as {{g4467}}; recklessness, i.e. (by extension) malignity

g4469.definition: [ῥακά] of Chaldee origin (compare {{h7386}}); O empty one, i.e. thou worthless (as a term of utter vilification)

g4470.definition: [ῥάκος] from {{g4486}}; a "rag," i.e. piece of cloth

g4471.definition: [Ῥαμᾶ] of Hebrew origin ({{h7414}}); Rama (i.e. Ramah), a place in Palestine

g4472.definition: [ῥαντίζω] from a derivative of ῥαίνω (to sprinkle); to render besprinkled, i.e. asperse (ceremonially or figuratively)

g4474.definition: [ῥαπίζω] from a derivative of a primary ῥέπω (to let fall, "rap"); to slap Compare {{g5180}}.

g4476.definition: [ῥαφίς] from a primary ῥάπτω (to sew; perhaps rather akin to the base of {{g4474}} through the idea of puncturing); a needle

g4477.definition: [Ῥαχάβ] from the same as {{g4460}}; Rachab, a Canaanitess

g4478.definition: [Ῥαχήλ] of Hebrew origin ({{h7354}}); Rachel, the wife of Jacob

g4479.definition: [Ῥεβέκκα] of Hebrew origin ({{h7259}}); Rebecca (i.e. Ribkah), the wife of Isaac

g4480.definition: [ῥέδα] of Latin origin; a rheda, i.e. four-wheeled carriage (wagon for riding)

g4481.definition: [Ῥεμφάν] by incorrect transliteration for a word of Hebrew origin ({{h3594}}); Remphan (i.e. Kijun), an Egyptian idol

g4482.definition: [ῥέω] a primary verb; for some tenses of which a prolonged form      ῥεύω is used to flow ("run"; as water)

g4483.definition: [ῥέω] , for certain tenses of which a prolonged form      ἐρέω is used; and both as alternate for {{g2036}}perhaps akin (or identical) with {{g4482}} (through the idea of pouring forth); to utter, i.e. speak or say Compare {{g3004}}.

g4484.definition: [Ῥήγιον] of Latin origin; Rhegium, a place in Italy

g4485.definition: [ῥῆγμα] from {{g4486}}; something torn, i.e. a fragment (by implication and abstractly, a fall)

g4486.definition: [ῥήγνυμι]  or      ῥήσσωboth prolonged forms of ῥήκω (which appears only in certain forms, and is itself probably a strengthened form of agnumi (see in {{g2608}})); to "break," "wreck" or "crack", i.e. (especially) to sunder (by separation of the parts; {{g2608}} being its intensive (with the preposition in composition), and {{g2352}} a shattering to minute fragments; but not a reduction to the constituent particles, like {{g3089}}) or disrupt, lacerate; by implication, to convulse (with spasms); figuratively, to give vent to joyful emotions

g4487.definition: [ῥῆμα] from {{g4483}}; an utterance (individually, collectively or specially),; by implication, a matter or topic (especially of narration, command or dispute); with a negative naught whatever

g4488.definition: [Ῥησά] probably of Hebrew origin (apparently for {{h7509}}); Resa (i.e. Rephajah), an Israelite

g4489.definition: [ῥήτωρ] from {{g4483}}; a speaker, i.e. (by implication) a forensic advocate

g4490.definition: [ῥητῶς] adverb from a derivative of {{g4483}}; out-spokenly, i.e. distinctly

g4491.definition: [ῥίζα] apparently a primary word; a "root" (literally or figuratively)

g4493.definition: [ῥιπή] from {{g4496}}; a jerk (of the eye, i.e. (by analogy) an instant)

g4494.definition: [ῥιπίζω] from a derivative of {{g4496}} (meaning a fan or bellows); to breeze up, i.e. (by analogy) to agitate (into waves)

g4495.definition: [ῥιπτέω] from a derivative of {{g4496}}; to toss up

g4496.definition: [ῥίπτω] a primary verb (perhaps rather akin to the base of {{g4474}}, through the idea of sudden motion); to fling (properly, with a quick toss, thus differing from {{g906}}, which denotes a deliberate hurl; and from τείνω (see in {{g1614}}), which indicates an extended projection); by qualification, to deposit (as if a load); by extension, to disperse

g4497.definition: [Ῥοβοάμ] of Hebrew origin ({{h7346}}); Roboam (i.e. Rechobam), an Israelite

g4498.definition: [Ῥόδη] probably for rhode (a rose); Rode, a servant girl

g4499.definition: [Ῥόδος] probably from ῥόδον (a rose); Rhodus, an island of the Mediterranean

g4500.definition: [ῥοιζηδόν] adverb from a derivative of ῥοῖζος (a whir); whizzingly, i.e. with a crash
